intro: Cuviera letestui, commonly known as the Letestu's cup, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, pale blue to white flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
